content: Just responded to a major incident downtown. Everyone safe! #emergency #response
Community safety meeting this Thursday at City Hall. Learn about our new emergency protocols.
Training exercise today was challenging but successful. #teamwork #emergency
Proud to announce our department has received new equipment funding that will help us better serve the community.
Reminder: If you see smoke, call 911 immediately. Don't assume someone else has called. #safety
Check your smoke detectors monthly! This simple action can save lives. Here's how to properly test them...
Difficult day on the job, but we made a difference. Remember to appreciate every moment. #ems #firstresponder
Hurricane season is approaching. Is your family prepared? Download our emergency checklist at the link below.
Seeking volunteers for our upcoming disaster preparedness training. No experience necessary, we will provide all training.
Communication is key during emergencies. Make sure your family has a plan and meeting point. #preparedness
Our annual fundraiser was a huge success! Thanks to everyone who attended and supported our department.
High winds expected this weekend. Secure loose items around your property to prevent them becoming projectiles. #weathersafety
New research on evacuation procedures shows significant improvement in evacuation times with proper planning.
Thank you to all who attended our CPR training yesterday. You now have the skills to potentially save a life!
Completed advanced vehicle extrication training today. These skills will help us in critical situations. #training
Flash flood warning in effect for southern counties. Avoid low-lying areas and stay tuned to local alerts.
Implemented new response protocols that have reduced our average response time by 23%. Proud of our team's dedication.
Busy night for our team. Multiple accidents due to icy conditions. Please drive carefully everyone. #winterdriving
Our station is hosting an open house next Saturday! Bring the kids to see the trucks and learn about fire safety.
Challenging water rescue operation completed successfully. All victims safe. Excellent teamwork from all agencies involved!
New integrated communication system deployed today. This will improve coordination between all emergency services.
School visits this week were a success! Over 500 children learned about fire safety and what to do in an emergency.
Deployed to assist with flood response in neighboring county. Working around the clock to help affected residents.
Congratulations to our newest graduates from the Fire Academy! Welcome to the service and stay safe out there.
Looking to connect with other emergency service leaders to share best practices in community resilience planning.
When seconds count, proper training matters. Proud of our team's rapid response to today's incident. #paramedicine
Free smoke detector installation program continues next week. Contact us to schedule an appointment for your home.
Station 8 crew rescued a family of ducks from a storm drain today. Not all heroes wear capes! #animalrescue
Testing new drone technology for search and rescue operations. Initial results are very promising.
Heat wave expected next week. Remember to stay hydrated and check on elderly neighbors and those without AC.
